com.hazelcast.nio.tcp.nonblocking

Class NonBlockingSocketWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.nio.tcp.nonblocking.AbstractHandler
      • com.hazelcast.nio.tcp.nonblocking.NonBlockingSocketWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MigratableHandler, SelectionHandler, SocketWriter, Runnable

    public final class NonBlockingSocketWriter
extends AbstractHandler
implements Runnable, SocketWriter
    The writing side of the TcpIpConnection.

        public int totalFramesPending()
        Description copied from interface: SocketWriter
        Returns the total number of packets (urgent and non normal priority) pending to be written to the socket.
        Specified by:

      • getLastWriteTimeMillis

        public long getLastWriteTimeMillis()
        Description copied from interface: SocketWriter
        Returns the last Clock.currentTimeMillis() that a write to the socket completed. Writing to the socket doesn't mean that data has been send or received; it means that data was written to the SocketChannel. It could very well be that this data is stuck somewhere in an io-buffer.
        Specified by:
        getLastWriteTimeMillis in interface SocketWriter
        Returns:
        the last time something was written to the socket.

      • getWriteHandler

        public WriteHandler getWriteHandler()
        Description copied from interface: SocketWriter
        Gets the WriteHandler that belongs to this SocketWriter. This method exists for the TextReadHandler, but probably should be deleted.
        Specified by:
        getWriteHandler in interface SocketWriter
        Returns:
        the WriteHandler

      • bytesPending

        public long bytesPending()

      • priorityBytesPending

        public long priorityBytesPending()

      • setProtocol

        public void setProtocol(String protocol)
        Description copied from interface: SocketWriter
        Sets the protocol this SocketWriter should use. This should be called only once at the beginning of the connection. See Protocols
        Specified by:
        setProtocol in interface SocketWriter
        Parameters:
        protocol - the protocol

      • write

        public void write(OutboundFrame frame)
        Description copied from interface: SocketWriter
        Offers a Frame to be written to the socket. No guarantees are made that the frame is going to be written or received by the other side.
        Specified by:
        write in interface SocketWriter
        Parameters:
        frame - the Frame to write.

      • getEventCount

        public long getEventCount()
        Description copied from interface: MigratableHandler
        Get number of events recorded by the current handler. It can be used to calculate whether this handler should be migrated to a different NonBlockingIOThread
        Specified by:
        getEventCount in interface MigratableHandler
        Returns:
        total number of events recorded by this handler

      • handle

        public void handle()
            throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: SelectionHandler
        Called when there are bytes available for reading, or space available to write. Any exception that leads to a termination of the connection like an IOException should not be handled in the handle method but should be propagated. The reason behind this is that the handle logic already is complicated enough and by pulling it out the flow will be easier to understand.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface SelectionHandler
        Throws:
        Exception

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: SocketWriter
        Closes this SocketWriter. This method can be called from an arbitrary thread, and should only be called once. This should be coordinated through the TcpIpConnection.close(String, Throwable) method.
        Specified by:
        close in interface SocketWriter

      • requestMigration

        public void requestMigration(NonBlockingIOThread newOwner)
        Description copied from interface: MigratableHandler
        Requests the MigratableHandler to move to the new NonBlockingIOThread. This call will not wait for the migration to complete. This method can be called by any thread, and will probably be called by the IOBalancer. Call is ignored when handler is moving to the same NonBlockingIOThread.
        Specified by:
        requestMigration in interface MigratableHandler
        Parameters:
        newOwner - the NonBlockingIOThread that is going to own this MigratableHandler

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
